did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Dept. of Soil, Crops, and Atmospheric Science records, 1900-1996.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture and Life Science.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records include a manuscript concerning the history of agronomy at Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records include a manuscript concerning the history of agronomy at Cornell University; eleven photograph albums pertaining to soils and crops, taken by Cornell professors E. O. Fippin, E. L. Worthen, Ernest VanAlstine, and others; correspondence and design material for Caldwell and Leland field houses, and Bradfield and Emerson Halls. Also, black and white photographs of department activities, 1950s and 1960s, and portraits of the faculty, 1920-1950. Also, photographic slides and photoprints and negatives (c.1905-1980), especially by Reeshon Feuer and Harry Kerr, of agronomic projects and tests; and Herbert B. Hartwig instructional materials for elementary agronomy.

Also, photographs, many well annotated, of 1930s and 1940s farm structures and equipment, soil conservation; framed print that served as a departmental registry of marriages; photograph of Chinese trainees; slides, and other papers and records.

did.unittitle: Scrapbooks of Farm Landscape - old photos and descriptions
Scrapbooks of Farm Landscape - old photos and descriptions

Various photos from the 1940s-1960s and Scrapbook, album #10 – created by Ernest VanAlstine, 1937. Includes photos of special interest: County Agent Groups; Virgil Experimental Station; pastures, oxen, tractors and tillage; Michigan trip; Caldwell Field experiments; corn; weeds; soybeans; silage; equipment; reforestation; soil conservation; C.R. Harrington; forage crops; Leo Hayes Scrapbook, album #11 – created by E.L. Worthen, 1936-1940. Includes photos of special interest: Virgil Experimental Field; Caldwell Field Plots; pastures; meeting of American Society of Agronomy; Alfred Forest erosion experiment; Kenwood Sheep Farm.
Framed print of woman with angels with departmental registry of marriages on back
Photos of Dept, faculty (including Hartwig) and a copy of “Agronomy at Cornell 1868-1980” by Marlin Cline, 1982.
Annual Reports
Green Acres Program
Cornell Feed Service Letter
Cooperative Grange League Federation Exchange, Inc.
Agronomy Dept. – Cooperative Extension
Reeshon Feuer Photo File

Photo of Chinese Agricultural Trainees at Cornell (1945-1946); slides of fields and pastures; glass negative of Prof. J.K. Wilson; photos of Professors Norah Johnston Wallace, MacDonald and Boutflour and various experiment stations.
Various negatives, including Boyce Farm Pond, Weir Shelter, Arnot Station and pastures.
Agronomy Dept – old photos, glass prints, and slides.
Alphabetical photo file – Harry Kerr – State Committee
Agronomy Extension Dept. photos and negatives
Slides, 1963 Sugar Beet Feasibility Study, Publications by H. B. Hartwig and Hartwig course material.
